turns.text: All right Well I am uh the product of uh I think as much the changing roles of women as anyone my mother uh - we come from - my mother and I were uh really prac- first generation divorce in our family

turns.label: sd

turns.text: when I was seven years old
And was I was the first one of anyone that that anyone had ever known to have divorce
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Of course now fifty percent divorces in the United States uh - my mother uh was treated very badly uh in by lot of people family members um especially from my fathers side of the family and also uh uh uh we were uh
turns.label: sv

turns.text: ostracized by his family uh basically just you know uh we just kind of dropped off the face of the earth
And they all felt that th- there was never an issue that my father was the was the cause of the reason for the split up even though he had impregnated another woman and forced the divorce
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh it was always my mothers fault she was not uh sufficient you know she just was not good enough What was wrong with her was she not attractive enough did she not take good enough care of her man to keep his interest It was that kind of an attitude

Um um thats sad It really is

So I am pretty I am pretty ob- pretty cons- I mean I am pretty aware of what goes on --
